definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: It is to be assumed that the information was then passed on to the AQ Khan nuclear proliferation network.
sentences.chinese: 它是假定该资料，然后转嫁到卡迪尔汗的核扩散网络。

sentences.english: Now, suppose you are a pure-blooded wizard or witch who wants to do just that.
sentences.chinese: 现在假定你是一个想这样做的巫师。

sentences.english: B is the assumed cross-section of the nucleus.
Pages are assumed to be delimited by form feeds.
We assume [clients] know what they want.
sentences.chinese: 我们假定客户知道他们需要什么。

sentences.english: The third part is "The human nature hypothesis and economic regulation law".
sentences.chinese: 第三部分是“人性假定与经济调制法”。

sentences.english: It is just the presupposition as such that causes the failures of previous art defining.
sentences.chinese: 这个错误的假定，正是以往艺术定义活动失败的原因。

sentences.english: Assuming, of course, that Roth doesn’t win the prize while hecan still enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 当然，那要假定罗斯未拿到奖品但仍可享有奖项。

sentences.english: This functionality assumes that you have a list of photos available.
sentences.chinese: 此功能假定您有一个可用的照片列表。

sentences.english: Foundation soil is usually considered to be rigid in the aseismic engineering design.
sentences.chinese: 在建筑结构的抗震工程设计中通常假定地基为刚性的。

sentences.english: Here we assume that we are dealing with 8bit pixels.
sentences.chinese: 假定我们正在处理8位像素。

sentences.english: First, we must postulate that if souls exist, they must have some mass.
sentences.chinese: 第一，我们必须假定灵魂存在，他们必须保有物质。

sentences.english: A well-written program avoids those assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 编写良好的程序可以避免这些假定。

sentences.english: None showed histologic features of the presumed underlying liver disease.
sentences.chinese: 没有人出现假定为肝硬化时的组织学特征。

sentences.english: In longitudinal data analysis, homogeneity of variance is a basic assumption.
sentences.chinese: 在纵向数据分析中，模型方差的齐性是一个基本假定。

sentences.english: The perfume consumer presumably assumes that the volume is resumed.
sentences.chinese: 喷鼻水消费者假定地设想音量已恢复。

definition: conclusion/verdict/CL:個|个[ge4]/to conclude/to reach a verdict
in simple terms/to put things simply/briefly
